metadata: (info { (description "Hue-Ta-Quee-Che-Ka is a race game played by the Havasupai people of Arizona.") (rules "A number of stones are arranged in a circle, with one larger gap. The gaps between the stones are the playing spaces. Any number of players, playing on two teams. Each team's sticks are moved in opposite directions around the circle. Three sticks, white on one side and red on the other, used as dice. The throws are as follows: three white sides = 10; two white and one red = 2, two red and one white = 3; three red = 5. ") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "849") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/race/reach/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Arizona, around 1898.") } ) (graphics { (show Edges Hidden) (piece Colour "Die" state:0 fillColour:(colour White)) (piece Colour "Die" state:1 fillColour:(colour Red)) })
